item.title: invalid option: with pg dir=/opt/PostgreSQL/9.0
item.description: I’d bet a lot of ruby devs actually found themselves stuck in this problem. You checkout a github repo, you run a bundle install and = duh = a gem cannot install because of a missing library. You’re sure you’ve already installed the library or dependency or whatever, but in a different path from the standard one (in this example I’m talking about PostgreSQL installed via the graphical installer instead of the ubuntu apt repo); so you issue the command
